intro: Murtughas anisoptera, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Murtughas anisoptera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
